intro: Lotononis steingroeveriana, commonly known as the Steingroever's lotonon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces pale yellow to white florets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
